flawed_nl_solution:
Sandra had 2 bags that each contained 6 pieces of candy so 2*6 = <<2*6=12>>12 pieces
Roger had 11 pieces of candy in one bag and 3 pieces in the other so 11+3 = <<11+3=41>>41 pieces
Roger had 41 pieces and Sandra had 12 pieces so Roger has 41-12 = <<41-12=29>>29 more pieces of candy
#### 29

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 14, not 41. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
